title: 5 Key Elements of Locus AG's CarbonNOW Program - No-Till Farmer
summary: The article discusses Locus AG's CarbonNOW program that pays farmers for sequestering carbon and outlines key details such as program eligibility, high ROI, guaranteed payments, third-party soil sampling, and a grower data portal.
green_innovation: FALSE. While the article discusses incentives for carbon sequestration and sustainable agricultural practices, it mainly focuses on a specific program offered by Locus AG rather than a broader innovation that significantly contributes to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of Locus AG's CarbonNOW program represents a new business process that differs significantly from standard farming practices, offering financial incentives for carbon sequestration, soil probiotics, and customer engagement through a data portal.
green_product: FALSE. The article highlights a program (CarbonNOW) and specific products (soil probiotics) offered by Locus AG, but it does not extensively cover the design, manufacturing, and usage aspects involved in the development of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article discusses how Locus AG's CarbonNOW program promotes sustainable agricultural practices, including carbon sequestration, soil probiotics, third-party soil sampling, and the utilization of grower data portals, thus aligning with the concept of green processes in manufacturing and agriculture.

greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it primarily focuses on discussing a legitimate carbon sequestration program offered by Locus AG, outlining its features and benefits without any indication of false or misleading environmental claims.

title: HYCO1 and Kansas Ethanol Collaborate on World's Largest Biogenic CO2 Utilization Facility - PR Newswire
summary: HYCO1, Inc. partners with Kansas Ethanol to build the world's largest biogenic carbon dioxide utilization facility, Green Carbon Synthetics Kansas, LLC, using innovative CO2 conversion technology for low-carbon products. The project aims to produce synthetic base oils and low-carbon jet fuel with significant carbon footprint reductions compared to traditional fossil-derived products. Kansas Ethanol emphasizes sustainability through carbon utilization to create value-added products, positioning them competitively and fostering environmental benefits.
green_innovation: TRUE. This collaboration between HYCO1 and Kansas Ethanol to utilize biogenic carbon dioxide and innovative CO2 conversion technology aligns with green innovation by significantly reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. The partnership between HYCO1 and Kansas Ethanol to build a carbon dioxide utilization facility for low-carbon product production represents a new and significant business process innovation creating value-added, sustainable products in the market.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the production of low-carbon synthetic base oils and low-carbon jet fuel using innovative CO2 conversion technology, which aligns with the definition of green products by significantly reducing environmental impacts throughout the life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The utilization of biogenic carbon dioxide and innovative CO2 conversion technology by HYCO1 and Kansas Ethanol to produce low-carbon products demonstrates a green process that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing, 324110 - Petroleum Refineries, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 324199 - All Other Petroleum and Coal Products Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not indicate any false or misleading environmental claims about the product or process innovation, focusing on actual environmental benefits and sustainability efforts.

title: REPLENISH NUTRIENTS ANNOUNCES $7 MILLION IN NON-DILUTIVE FUNDING - Canada NewsWire
summary: Replenish Nutrients Ltd., a subsidiary of EarthRenew Inc., has been awarded a $7 million grant to construct a regenerative fertilizer manufacturing facility in Alberta. The facility aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, support local job creation, and provide a sustainable alternative to traditional fertilizers.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article describes the development of a regenerative fertilizer manufacturing facility that aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote sustainability in agriculture, aligning with the principles of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses the introduction of a new manufacturing facility for regenerative fertilizers, which represents a new business process in the agricultural sector, qualifying as a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE: The regenerative fertilizer manufactured by Replenish Nutrients can be considered a green product as it is designed to significantly reduce environmental impacts throughout its lifecycle by using sustainable production processes and eco-friendly materials.
green_process: TRUE: The regenerative fertilizer manufacturing process described in the article qualifies as a green process as it aims to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, conserve resources, and limit the release of harmful substances.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325314 - Fertilizer (Mixing Only) Manufacturing, 325311 - Nitrogenous Fertilizer Manufacturing, 325312 - Phosphatic Fertilizer Manufacturing, 325314 - Fertilizer (Mixing Only) Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it provides detailed information about the environmental benefits of the regenerative fertilizer and the sustainability goals of the project.
